intro: Lastrea obovata, commonly known as the broad-ovate lastrea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly known as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its water-storing tissues. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in rock gardens and xeriscapes.
